pros: PCC was a great place to work, salary was good, coworkers were great, and a healthy work life balance is encouraged!
cons: Nonprofit work can be hard but it’s always fulfilling!

pros: The pros of this job included the people I got to work with, including my team members. The clinical side of the clinic seemed nice; I worked on the administrative side of things. The doctors were always friendly and knowledgeable. Health insurance and PTO are pretty good.
cons: The current management is going to run this clinic into the ground. My boss was condescending, insensitive, and a micromanager who wouldn't let you do your job. not to mention that they didn't even know how to do many aspects of the job. My POC coworkers and I faced daily microagressions in this space. If you work here, be prepared to be underpaid, taken advantage of, and gaslit. Overall, this clinic is run by white people who pretend that they care about their POC workers and patients but are more interested in their own status within the community and clinic. There is a reason for the high turnover rate they experience.

pros: You help people that need it.

cons: Nothing bad to add to my experience.
Management is the worst, they do not listen to what employees have to say about their bosses who can be verbally abusive
